value.title: China publishes code of ethics to regulate Artificial Intelligence, what would Isaac Asimov say?
value.excerpt: Going ahead of Europe, China has already published a six-point code of ethics to regulate Artificial Intelligence, giving 'full decision-making power' to humans, very similar to Isaac Asimov's laws of robotics.

value.title: The CIO's guide to managing enterprise AI

value.title: The limitations of AI safety tools
value.excerpt: Firms including OpenAI have developed safety tools to constrain AI decision-making. But there's a limit to what these tools can accomplish.

value.title: Preparing for the 'golden age' of artificial intelligence and machine learning
value.excerpt: The latest ZDNet survey on AI actionability and accountability finds that IT teams are taking a direct lead, with most companies building in-house systems. However, oversight of AI-generated decisions is lagging.

value.title: Thoughts on AI ethics getting concrete and useful

value.title: AI ethics is growing up - towards an AI maturity model organizations can use

value.title: UK announces a national strategy to ‘level up’ AI

value.title: Google’s Former AI Ethics Chief Has a Plan to Rethink Big Tech
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru is one of the leading voices working on ethics in artificial intelligence. Her research has explored ways to combat biases, such as racism and sexism, that creep into AI through flawed data and creators.

value.title: "F In Ethics": UN Chief Grades World On Vaccine Rollout
value.excerpt: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres termed the inequitable distribution of COVID-19 vaccines as an "obscenity".
